node.title: Convicted murderer escapes prison again, caught after running out of gas
node.description: Some prison employees were suspended because the staff waited more than a day to tell the Department of Corrections he was missing, officials said.

node.title: Tanker crash sparks massive fire with 60 foot high flames
node.description: The blaze sent the driver and two firefighters to hospitals and gasoline flowing into sewers. Flames were coming out of manholes. There was no word on the cause.

node.title: MLB players, Tyler Skaggs' widow give dramatic testimony
node.description: 4 players say they received drugs and Skaggs' widow testifies about the last text she received from him before he was found dead.

node.title: What are Putin's immediate and long-term objectives in Ukraine?
node.description: Intelligence experts discuss state of the Russia-Ukraine crisis and whether diplomatic options remain viable.

node.title: NATO says Russian military buildup continues on Ukraine's "Unity Day"
node.description: Russia suggests Western doubts over its military pullback claims are due to a "handicap" in NATO's "system for assessing the situation."

node.title: Shark attack kills man in city's first such death in almost 60 years
node.description: Sydney, Australia hadn't had a fatal shark attack since 1963. It uses warning apps, nets and drones to try to prevent them.

node.title: Gun maker held liable for Sandy Hook shooting that killed 20 children
node.description: The case is significant because it is the first time a gun maker has been held liable for a mass shooting in the US.

node.title: Ottawa police chief resigns as Canadian protesters dig in
node.description: Ottawa's police chief has resigned after criticism that he did not do enough to stop Covid-19 protests that have paralysed Canada's capital city and forced Prime Minister Justin Trudeau to invoke…

node.title: Hipkins on rapid antigen tests: 'Change soon' on permission for retail sale
node.description: Covid-19 Response Minister Chris Hipkins has confirmed the government is working to give retailers permission to sell rapid antigen tests. Audio

node.title: Covid-19 daily community case numbers surge to 1160
node.description: There are 1160 new community cases of Covid-19 being reported today.

node.title: San Francisco recalls 3 school board members after year of controversy
node.description: Critics say the board had called misplaced priorities and put progressive politics over the needs of children during the pandemic,

node.title: Marylands child abuse 'cause of deep shame and sorrow' - Archbishop
node.description: Stories from survivors of abuse at Marylands School are heartbreaking, says Catholic Archbishop Paul Martin.

node.title: Take menopause seriously, women tell employers
node.description: The Detail - Women are starting to talk about menopause and employers are being warned to ignore it at their peril.

node.title: DOC team to fly in to assess flood-damaged Heaphy Track
node.description: The Department of Conservation will fly in a four-person team to assess the damage caused to a Great Walk during recent flooding on the West Coast.

node.title: Rental property managers would be licensed under government proposal
node.description: Rental property managers would need a licence, and be subject to an independent complaints process under the government's preferred option for regulation.

node.title: Picton protesters refuse to move despite council deadline
node.description: One of the protesters occupying a Picton park says they will not leave by 5pm today as requested by Marlborough District Council.

node.title: Health and animal care products company EBOS posts another record half year profit
node.description: Revenue for the community pharmacy for the six months ending December was A$3.15 billion (NZ$3.4b)

node.title: Bloomfield, experts and officials explain home isolation and supports
node.description: One in 10 people going to Middlemore Hospital's emergency department are testing positive for Covid-19, the Director-General of Health has revealed at a briefing on how home isolation will work.

node.title: Immigration NZ to better manage second round of residence visa applications
node.description: Up to 1500 individuals will be able to apply each day from 21 February in the order of the date the individual submitted their EOI. They will receive an email from INZ on the day they are able to…

node.title: Sadowski-Synnott heads to Canada
node.description: Zoi Sadowski-Synnott heads to the backcountry to celebrate remarkable Olympic medal haul

node.title: Four people rescued from burning motor launch off Wellington's South Coast
node.description: Maritime police say a fishing boat crew managed to get the four adults off the 12-metre launch and they are now being transferred to the police launch, the Lady Elizabeth.

node.title: First Black Congressman honored at U.S. Capitol
node.description: "Study the history. Know their history," said Representative Jim Clyburn in an interview with CBS News.

node.title: Commonwealth Games tipped to return to Australia
node.description: The 2026 Commonwealth Games are set to be awarded to Victoria in Australia.

node.title: Doubling of profit from construction sector lifts Fletcher Building result
node.description: Fletcher Building has reported a solid lift in first-half profit as it benefited from a strong housing market and building boom.

node.title: Labour holds strong, National on the up in latest political poll
node.description: The latest Taxpayers' Union Curia Poll has Labour inching up about a point to 42.3 percent and National gaining 5.4 points to 38.4 percent since last month's poll results.

node.title: Infants born to vaccinated mothers are less likely to be hospitalized with COVID
node.description: Babies born to mothers who were vaccinated while pregnant were 61% less likely to be hospitalized with COVID-19.

node.title: Avocado, kiwifruit growers counting cost of Cyclone Dovi's winds
node.description: The strong winds that lashed the country at the weekend have caused significant damage to some kiwifruit and avocado orchards in the Bay of Plenty.

node.title: Government to deliver Budget on 19 May
node.description: The date has been announced for this year's Budget, which Finance Minister Grant Robertson says will focus on planned health reforms and meeting climate change goals.

node.title: Prince Andrew reaches settlement in US civil sex assault case
node.description: Prince Andrew has settled a civil sexual assault case brought against him in the US by Virginia Giuffre, court documents show.

node.title: 'You will see some tow activity today': Police ready to get protesters' vehicles moved
node.description: The Police Commissioner admits some tow companies are reluctant to help with the removal of vehicles near Parliament but says some towing will begin today. Audio
